speaker: Sarah
text: If we had a dedicated UX designer on the team, our interfaces would look way more polished.
ipa: ɪf wi hæd ə ˈdɛdɪkeɪtɪd ˌjuː ɛks dɪˈzaɪnɚ ɑn ðə tim | aʊɚ ˈɪntɚˌfeɪsɪz wʊd lʊk weɪ mɔɹ ˈpɑlɪʃt
stress: IF we HAD a DEDICATED UX DESIGNER on the TEAM | our INTERFACES would LOOK WAY more POLISHED
linking:
"had a" → /hæd ə/ (d + a linking)
"designer on" → /dɪˈzaɪnɚ ɑn/ (r + o linking)
"would look" → /wʊd lʊk/ (d + l linking)

speaker: Leo
text: I agree. If the stakeholders gave us more flexibility, we could experiment with better design patterns.
ipa: aɪ əˈɡɹi | ɪf ðə ˈsteɪkˌhoʊldɚz ɡeɪv ʌs mɔɹ ˌflɛksəˈbɪləti | wi kʊd ɪkˈspɛɹəmənt wɪð ˈbɛtɚ dɪˈzaɪn ˈpætɚnz
stress: I AGREE | IF the STAKEHOLDERS GAVE us MORE FLEXIBILITY | we COULD EXPERIMENT with BETTER DESIGN PATTERNS
linking:
"gave us" → /ɡeɪv ʌs/ (v + u linking)
"could experiment" → /kʊd ɪkˈspɛɹəmənt/ (d + e linking)

speaker: Sarah
text: Yeah, and if we weren’t rushing every release, we would catch more usability issues.
ipa: jæ | ənd ɪf wi ˈwɝnt ˈɹʌʃɪŋ ˈɛvɚi ɹɪˈlis | wi wʊd kæʧ mɔɹ ˌjuːzəˈbɪləti ˈɪʃuz
stress: YEAH | and IF we WEREN’T RUSHING EVERY RELEASE | we WOULD CATCH MORE USABILITY ISSUES
linking:
"weren’t rushing" → /ˈwɝnt ˈɹʌʃɪŋ/ (t + r linking)
"catch more" → /kæʧ mɔɹ/ (ch + m linking)

speaker: Leo
text: Exactly. If the roadmap allowed more breathing room, our features might be more refined.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | ɪf ðə ˈɹoʊdˌmæp əˈlaʊd mɔɹ ˈbɹiðɪŋ ɹum | aʊɚ ˈfiʧɚz maɪt bi mɔɹ ɹɪˈfaɪnd
stress: EXACTLY | IF the ROADMAP ALLOWED MORE BREATHING ROOM | our FEATURES MIGHT BE MORE REFINED
linking:
"roadmap allowed" → /ˈɹoʊdˌmæp əˈlaʊd/ (p + a linking)
"might be" → /maɪt bi/ (t + b linking)

speaker: Sarah
text: Also, if marketing communicated changes earlier, we wouldn’t have to redo designs last minute.
ipa: ˈɔlsoʊ | ɪf ˈmɑɹkətɪŋ kəˈmjunəˌkeɪtɪd ˈʧeɪnʤɪz ˈɝliɚ | wi ˈwʊdənt hæv tə ˈɹidu dɪˈzaɪnz læst ˈmɪnɪt
stress: ALSO | IF MARKETING COMMUNICATED CHANGES EARLIER | we WOULDN’T HAVE to REDO DESIGNS LAST MINUTE
linking:
"communicated changes" → /kəˈmjunəˌkeɪtɪd ˈʧeɪnʤɪz/ (d + ch linking)
"redo designs" → /ˈɹidu dɪˈzaɪnz/ (u + d linking)

speaker: Leo
text: Ugh, yes. If I were in charge of timelines, I would add a review buffer after every sprint.
ipa: ʌɡ | jɛs | ɪf aɪ wɝ ɪn ʧɑɹʤ əv ˈtaɪmˌlaɪnz | aɪ wʊd æd ə ɹɪˈvju ˈbʌfɚ ˈæftɚ ˈɛvɚi spɹɪnt
stress: UGH, YES | IF I WERE IN CHARGE of TIMELINES | I WOULD ADD a REVIEW BUFFER AFTER EVERY SPRINT
linking:
"were in" → /wɝ ɪn/ (r + i linking)
"add a" → /æd ə/ (d + a linking)

speaker: Sarah
text: That would help a lot. If QA had more visibility earlier, we could prevent those late surprises.
ipa: ðæt wʊd hɛlp ə lɑt | ɪf ˌkjuː ˈeɪ hæd mɔɹ ˌvɪzəˈbɪləti ˈɝliɚ | wi kʊd pɹɪˈvɛnt ðoʊz leɪt səˈpɹaɪzɪz
stress: THAT WOULD HELP a LOT | IF QA HAD MORE VISIBILITY EARLIER | we COULD PREVENT THOSE LATE SURPRISES
linking:
"help a" → /hɛlp ə/ (p + a linking)
"prevent those" → /pɹɪˈvɛnt ðoʊz/ (t + th linking)

speaker: Leo
text: And honestly, if we trusted each team’s expertise more, the whole process would run smoother.
ipa: ænd ˈɑnəstli | ɪf wi ˈtɹʌstɪd itʃ timz ˌɛkspɚˈtiz mɔɹ | ðə hoʊl ˈpɹɑsɛs wʊd ɹʌn ˈsmuðɚ
stress: AND HONESTLY | IF WE TRUSTED EACH TEAM’S EXPERTISE MORE | the WHOLE PROCESS WOULD RUN SMOOTHER
linking:
"trusted each" → /ˈtɹʌstɪd itʃ/ (d + e linking)
"process would" → /ˈpɹɑsɛs wʊd/ (s + w linking)
